items.headline: TJ Maxx parent’s sales surge, as consumers continue to enjoy the hunt for off-price goods
items.summary_en: Shares of the parent company of T.J. Maxx and Marshalls climbed into record territory as quarterly results beat on all the key metrics, as customers continued to flock to its off-price goods.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Target sales disappoint as store traffic and spending decline
items.summary_en: Target’s stock was falling as profit beat expectations, but the full-year outlook was trimmed and comparable sales declined for a third consecutive quarter.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Lowe’s delivers an earnings beat, and tops Home Depot on a key sales metric
items.summary_en: Lowe’s stock bounces after comparable-sales growth missed expectations but outpaced that of its key rival, as profit beat expectations.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Bud Light’s struggling. Now its owner is reportedly buying a punch maker.
items.summary_en: Anheuser-Busch InBev , one of the world’s largest beer companies and owner of brands like Budweiser, Stella Artois and Michelob, is reportedly in talks to buy BeatBox, a manufacturer of boxed, wine-based punch, for around $700 million.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: T-bill and chill: Robinhood CIO on what to do after the selloff and the danger markets are ignoring
items.summary_en: The best move investors can make right now may be to just ‘sit tight,’ says Robinhood’s CIO Stephanie Guild.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Expect more secondhand holiday gifts this year — thanks in part to Gen Z’s love of thrifting
items.summary_en: As households face tighter budgets, experts anticipate more people will shop secondhand for gifts this holiday season.
